ai.summary: A challenging 21.9 km coastal circuit along the Marloes Peninsula in Pembrokeshire, UK. Expect rugged cliff paths, exposed sea views, and varying terrain that demands good endurance, navigation, and weather preparation.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal terrain with cliff-top paths, uneven tracks, grassy sections, rocky steps, and occasional beach areas. The route includes exposed sections and can be muddy after rain. Sea spray and strong winds are common along the coast.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times and daylight hours before setting off. Avoid unstable cliff edges and stay on marked paths. Wear sturdy ankle supporting boots and bring layers for changing weather. Carry a map and compass in addition to a GPS device; ensure sufficient water and food. Inform someone of your plan and expected finish time; mobile reception can be unreliable in remote areas; carry a small first aid kit and an emergency whistle.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Map, compass, or fully charged GPS
Emergency whistle and basic first aid kit
Headlamp or flashlight (for early starts or late finishes)
Optional: lightweight rain pants or gaiters for mud
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly March to September) offer milder weather, longer daylight, and better conditions for coastal walking. Winter hikes can be stormy, wet, and less safe.

seo.title: Marloes Peninsula Coastal Walk – 21.9 km Hard Coastal Hike in Pembrokeshire, UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle the demanding 21.9 km Marloes Peninsula Coastal Walk in Pembrokeshire, UK. Rugged cliffs, tidal beaches, and sweeping sea views await; prepare with the right gear and safety tips.
